He said that 5G will help India achieve the goal of $40-trillion economy by 2047 and help increase per capita income from $2,000 to $20,000.

176.title: Putin's latest actions most serious escalation since war began: NATO
176.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg has accused Russian President Vladimir Putin of provoking "the most serious escalation" of the war in Ukraine since it began in February. "We've the combination of the mobilisation in Russia, combined with the...dangerous nuclear rhetoric, and then...illegal annexation," Stoltenberg said. The escalation will not deter NATO from supporting Ukraine, he added.

177.title: Suvendu accuses Mamata-led WB govt of 'illegally diverting funds'
177.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari has written a letter to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in which he accused state CM Mamata Banerjee-led government of illegally diverting funds provided by the Centre. Adhikari claimed that a major portion of the funds was transferred to the State Emergency Relief Fund which is controlled by the CM's Office.

178.title: PM Modi drives car in Europe remotely from India using 5G, video surfaces
178.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday conducted test drive of a car in Europe remotely from India using 5G technology at the India Mobile Congress 2022. He drove the remote controlled car, which was set up to navigate a closed indoor course in Sweden. Sharing a picture of PM conducting the test, Union Minister Piyush Goyal tweeted, "India driving the world."

179.title: Nord Stream leaks likely single largest methane release ever: UN
179.article_body: The UN Environment Programme said the ruptures on the Nord Stream natural gas pipeline system under the Baltic Sea have led to what's "likely the largest emission" of climate-damaging methane ever recorded. According to environmental data company GHGSat, the leak rate from one of four rupture points was 22,920 kg/h, equivalent to burning about 2,86,000 kg of coal every hour.

180.title: Gurugram may host some G20 meetings in 2023: Official
180.article_body: A team from the Ministry of External Affairs held a meeting with local officers in Gurugram on Friday. The city is likely to host a few G20 meetings after India assumes the Presidency of the group on December 1st this year. "Four to five meetings are likely to be held in the city, involving 300-400 foreign delegates," an official said.

181.title: 5 RSS leaders in Kerala get Y security over threat from PFI: Report
181.article_body: Five RSS leaders in Kerala have been given Y security cover by the central government over suspected threats from banned organisation PFI, reported PTI quoting sources. The CRPF's VIP security wing has been put up to the task. The leaders are believed to be targets of PFI as per documents recovered by central investigative agencies during recent raids.

182.title: Priyanka Chopra interviews US VP Harris, discusses mansplaining, abortion rights
182.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra on Friday interviewed the US Vice President Kamala Harris at the women's leadership forum organised by the Democratic National Committee in Washington. Chopra and Harris discussed various topics including mansplaining, reproductive rights and gun laws. Pointing to the silence in the room, Chopra joked, "Do you hear that sound? That is the sound of no mansplaining, ladies."

183.title: Man kills 8-year-old grandniece for refusing to bring tobacco in MP
183.article_body: A 60-year-old man allegedly killed his eight-year-old grandniece with an axe and buried her body in a heap of fodder in Madhya Pradesh's Guna, a police official said on Friday. The incident occurred after the grandniece "refused to bring tobacco from a nearby shop despite repeated requests", the SP said. The accused has been arrested, the SP added.

184.title: Mallikarjun Kharge resigns as Rajya Sabha Leader of Opposition
184.article_body: In line with Congress' resolution of 'one person, one post', senior leader Mallikarjun Kharge resigned as the Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha after filing nomination for his party's President post. He submitted his resignation to party chief Sonia Gandhi. As the head of the Congress parliamentary party, Gandhi will have to appoint a new Leader of Opposition.

185.title: Ex-Maharashtra minister allegedly threatens to kill man; FIR filed
185.article_body: An FIR has been filed after former Maharashtra minister and NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal and two others allegedly threatened to kill a man, an official said. The man said that he was threatened for "forwarding two videos to Bhujbal, in which the latter allegedly spoke against Hindu religion", an official said. Bhujbal is currently the MLA for Yeola.

186.title: Which 13 Indian cities will first get the newly-launched 5G services?
186.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday launched 5G services in selected cities in India. While the service will be available to the entire country in a couple of years, the network will be launched in 13 Indian cities first. The cities are, namely, Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chandigarh, Chennai, Delhi, Gandhinagar, Gurugram, Hyderabad, Jamnagar, Kolkata, Lucknow, Mumbai and Pune.

187.title: Pune Police busts call centre of instant loan apps, 18 arrested
187.article_body: Pune Police busted a call centre of instant loan apps and arrested 18 persons for issuing threats and harassing defaulters. Police received 4,778 complaints from 2020 to 2022 in which people claimed they were abused and harassed, Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta said. "These apps seek access to the camera, photos, contacts and storage on mobile phones," Gupta added.

188.title: Woman touches feet of Arun Govil who played Lord Ram in Ramayan, video surfaces
188.article_body: A woman was seen touching the feet of actor Arun Govil, who played Lord Ram in the television serial 'Ramayan'. She was seen bowing down in front of him at the Mumbai Airport while the actor stood with folded hands. A video of the incident has surfaced online. The woman also got pictures clicked with the actor.

189.title: Parag is trying to please people: Musk to Dorsey after offering to buy Twitter
189.article_body: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk offered to acquire Twitter, a text conversation between him and Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey surfaced. Musk wrote to Dorsey, "Parag is just moving far too slowly and trying to please people who will not be happy no matter what he does." Dorsey replied, "At least it became clear that you can't work together."

190.title: mCaffeine announces Buy 1 Get 1 Sale & free iPhones on its 6th birthday
190.article_body: Natural & 100% vegan brand mCaffeine has announced its Buy 1 Get 1 Sale to celebrate its 6th birthday. With offers as big as BOGO days, chances to win big prizes like iPhone 14 every day and a sponsored trip to Goa, the brand is going bigger than ever, it shared, adding that the sale goes live for 6 days.

191.title: Cong only party in country that elects its President: Jairam Ramesh
191.article_body: Former Union Minister Jairam Ramesh praised the Congress and said that it's the only party in the country that elects its President. "The other parties do not have elections to this effect. Our party has a system. It makes no difference whether the elections are won by Rajya Sabha leader Mallikarjun Kharge or former Union Minister Shashi Tharoor," said Ramesh.

192.title: Burkina Faso's military leader ousted in second coup this year
192.article_body: A group of Burkina Faso army soldiers announced that the country's coup leader-turned-President, Lieutenant Colonel Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba, has been ousted. Captain Ibrahim Traore, the new leader of Burkina Faso, said that Damiba was removed due to his inability to deal with a worsening Islamist insurgency. Damiba had ousted former President Roch Kabore in January citing the same reason.

193.title: PM Narendra Modi launches 5G services in selected cities in India
193.article_body: PM Narendra Modi launched 5G services in selected cities at India Mobile Congress on Saturday. The service is expected to cover the entire country over the next couple of years. In August, the Centre received bids worth ₹1.50 lakh crore from the spectrum auction. Reliance Jio, Adani Group, Bharti Airtel, and Vodafone Idea were the four participants in the auction.

194.title: India's forex reserves record steepest weekly fall in 6 months
194.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell by $8.134 billion to $537.518 billion for the week ended September 23, the RBI data showed. This is the steepest weekly fall in six months and reserves have fallen for eight straight weeks now. This decline was due to a dip in the foreign currency assets which decreased by $7.688 billion to $477.212 billion.

195.title: Telangana hikes quota for STs to 10% in educational institutes, govt jobs
195.article_body: K Chandrashekar Rao-led Telangana government has hiked the reservation for Scheduled Tribes (STs) from 6% to 10% in educational institutes and state government services with effect from October 1. The overall quota in the state for various categories has now gone up to 54%. A bill on the 10% reservation was passed by the Telangana Assembly in April 2017.

196.title: India's core sectors grew 3.3% in August, lowest in 9 months
196.article_body: India's core sectors grew 3.3% in August, which is the lowest in nine months. It had grown 4.5% in July, while in August last year, it was 12.2%. Except for crude oil and natural gas, which contracted by 3.3% and 0.9%, respectively, all sectors including coal, refinery products, electricity, fertilisers, cement and steel posted growth.

197.title: Fiscal deficit widens to ₹5.42 lakh crore in April-August period
197.article_body: India's fiscal deficit for the April-August period of the current financial year touched ₹5.42 lakh crore or 32.6% of annual estimates, government data showed on Friday. In the year-ago period, the fiscal deficit had touched 31.1% of the annual estimates. Net tax receipts surged to about ₹7 lakh crore, while total expenditure was ₹13.9 lakh crore.

198.title: We condemn continued targeting of innocent students: India on Kabul terror attack
198.article_body: India has condemned the terror attack at Kaaj Educational Center in Kabul on Friday that killed at least 19 people and injured many others. "We are saddened by yesterday's terror attack...and extend our condolences to the families of the victims. India strongly condemns the continued targeting of innocent students at educational places," External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said.

199.title: Twitch to charge viewers $100 to pin chat messages for 2.5 minutes
199.article_body: Twitch is testing a paid feature called 'Elevated Chat' that will allow viewers to get their chat messages highlighted for a specific amount of time. The feature comes with five different pricing tiers, ranging from $5 for 30 seconds to $100 for 2.5 minutes. Twitch will give streamers a 70/30 cut of revenue from elevated chats after taxes and fees.

200.title: Pune police rescue 3 women after busting prostitution racket
200.article_body: Pune police rescued three women after busting a prostitution racket by laying a trap using decoy customers. A person who trafficked women was also arrested. A police inspector said that the modus operandi was that a person called the customers and sent them photos of women. Phone, cash and an autorickshaw worth a total of ₹62,500 were seized, officials said.

201.title: Centre extends AFSPA in several districts of Nagaland, Arunachal
201.article_body: The central government extended the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act or AFSPA in nine districts and 16 police stations in four other districts of Nagaland from October 1 to March 30, 2023. It also extended AFSPA in three districts of Arunachal Pradesh, including Tirap, Changlang and Longding, and areas falling within the jurisdiction of Namsai and Mahadevpur police stations.

202.title: Avalanche hits mountains surrounding Kedarnath temple, no damage to temple
202.article_body: An avalanche hit the Himalayan mountains surrounding the Kedarnath Temple, news agency ANI reported. Shri Badrinath-Kedarnath Temple Committee President, Ajendra Ajay, said that no damage was done to the Kedarnath temple due to the avalanche. ANI shared a video of the incident, showing the movement of snow during the avalanche at a faraway mountain.

203.title: I kinda don't think I should be the boss of anyone: Musk told Twitter CEO in a text
203.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk told Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal in a text message that he "kinda thinks" he shouldn't be the "boss of anyone". Musk told Agrawal, "Frankly, I hate doing mgmt stuff...But I love helping solve technical/product design problems." The texts were released as part of the ongoing documentation ahead of their trial starting October 17.

204.title: Girl who received 'condom' remark offered free supply of pads, funding for education
204.article_body: Bihar's Riya Kumari, who was told "next you will want free condoms" by an IAS officer, has been offered a year's worth of free sanitary pads. "A small token of...appreciation for her conviction to put an end to...bloody hypocrisy around menstruation," CEO of a Delhi-based company said. The company will also bear cost of her education fees through her graduation.

205.title: MP HC sees violent protests as lawyer kills self after pleading in court
205.article_body: Madhya Pradesh High Court witnessed violent protests by advocates as a lawyer allegedly died by suicide after pleading in the Jabalpur bench. Some policemen suffered injuries, Jabalpur SP said. The protesting lawyers allegedly vandalised courtrooms and set ablaze a senior advocate's office. This comes after the deceased allegedly had an altercation with a judge during a bail plea hearing.

206.title: 4 accused to be tried as adults in Hyderabad Jubilee Hills gangrape
206.article_body: Four of the five minors accused in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills gangrape case will be tried as adults, said a Juvenile Justice Board on Friday. The accused had offered lift to a 17-year-old girl and then took turns raping her inside a car. The Principal Magistrate noted that the four minors were capable of understanding the consequences of their actions.

207.title: Gadkari asks Mercedes to produce affordable cars locally, says 'Even I can't afford them'
207.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari urged Mercedes-Benz to produce more cars locally and emphasised reducing costs. Speaking at the company's event, he said, "You increase the production, only then is it possible to reduce cost. We're middle-class people, even I can't afford your car." The company has launched EQS 580 4MATIC in India, its first locally assembled electric car.

208.title: 9 foreigners arrested as protests continue in Iran over Amini's death
208.article_body: Iran's Intelligence Ministry said on Friday that nine foreign nationals had been arrested in connection with the ongoing protests over the death of a 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini in police custody. The citizens from Germany, Poland, Italy, France, the Netherlands, Sweden and other countries were detained "during the riots or while plotting in the background", the ministry added.

209.title: Telangana CM KCR visits Yadadri temple, offers gold worth ₹52 lakh
209.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Friday visited the Sri Lakshminarasimha Swamy Temple in Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district along with his family members. On Rao's behalf, his grandson offered a cheque of over ₹52 lakh to the temple as a donation for buying 1.16 kg of gold. The gold will be used for gold plating the "gopuram" at the temple.

210.title: Massive fire breaks out at Gurugram's Global Foyer Mall, several fire tenders rushed
210.article_body: A massive fire broke out at the Global Foyer Mall situated on the Golf Course Road in Gurugram on Saturday morning. The fire reportedly broke out on the first floor of the mall. Several fire tenders were rushed to the site and officials said that the fire has been brought under control. No casualties were reported in the incident.

211.title: North Korea fires 4th round of missile tests in 1 week
211.article_body: North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles on Saturday, marking the fourth round of such a test in a week. South Korean military said it spotted the launches 18 minutes apart. Notably, amid North Korea's missile tests, the navies of South Korea, the US and Japan staged trilateral anti-submarine exercises on Friday for the first time in five years.

212.title: Introducing India’s first ever investment festival: ET Money
212.article_body: ET Money has launched the Great Indian Investment Festival that promises rewards worth ₹20 lakh for tax savings and investments. Users can get flat 60% off on Genius membership, up to ₹2 lakh of referral rewards and assured Amazon vouchers. Lucky draw winners will also get iPhone 14 Plus, iPad Air 5 and Royal Enfield Interceptor, said the brand.

213.title: Musk unveils prototype of Tesla's humanoid robot, to cost less than a car
213.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk unveiled a prototype of humanoid robot, dubbed 'Optimus', during the company's AI Day event on Saturday. During the event, the robot walked onstage, waved hello and danced. "The robot can actually do a lot more...We just didn't want it to fall on its face," said Musk, adding that it's expected to cost less than a car.

214.title: 6-year-old beaten to death for eating apple from 'prasad' in Bihar
214.article_body: A six-year-old boy was allegedly beaten to death for eating an apple from 'prasad' or offering meant for Goddess Durga at a school in Bihar's Gaya. "The owners of the school kept Vivek in a room and brutally assaulted him. After the physical assault, they threw him outside the premises," said the victim's grandfather. Police have arrested the accused.

215.title: Robinhood to close 5 more offices in US, no worker to be laid off
215.article_body: Robinhood Markets on Friday said it will partially or completely shut down five more offices in the US as part of its restructuring plan to cut expenses. The California-based brokerage company said the closures, which will result in restructuring charges of around $45 million, will be done without any job cuts. Robinhood fired around 23% of its employees in August.

216.title: No direct trains from Noida Electronic City to Dwarka Sec 21 on Sunday till 2 pm: DMRC
216.article_body: No direct Metro trains will be available from Noida Electronic City to Dwarka/Dwarka Sector-21 on Sunday till 2 PM due to track maintenance work between Yamuna Bank and Akshardham stations, DMRC said. "Train services...will be operated in two loops- regular services from Dwarka Sector-21 to Yamuna Bank in one loop...Yamuna Bank to Noida Electronic City in another loop," DMRC added.

217.title: Price of 19-kg LPG cylinder cut by ₹25.50, new price list for cities released
217.article_body: Oil marketing companies have announced a price cut of ₹25.50 for a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder with immediate effect. With the latest revision, the 19-kg LPG cylinder now costs ₹1,859 in Delhi, ₹1,959 in Kolkata, ₹1,811.50 in Mumbai and ₹2,009.50 in Chennai. Earlier in September, the cost of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was slashed by up to ₹100.

218.title: Intel's self-driving technology firm Mobileye files for IPO in US
218.article_body: Mobileye, an Intel-owned firm that makes chips and software for self-driving cars, has filed a prospectus in US to get listed on Nasdaq. While the prospectus didn't mention price range for the proposed listing, Bloomberg earlier reported that Intel expects the IPO to value Mobileye at up to $30 billion. Intel acquired the Israeli company in 2017 for $15.3 billion.

219.title: Will concrete every inch of Mumbai roads in 3 years: BMC Commissioner
219.article_body: The BMC Commissioner, Iqbal Chahal, informed the Bombay HC on Friday that within three years, every inch of Mumbai's roads, lanes and bylanes will be concreted. However, he added that Mumbai will not be pothole-free until the BMC becomes the single planning authority to look after maintenance work. The civic body also submitted a list of the 20 worst roads.

220.title: New COVID-19 cases drop below 100 in Bengaluru, no deaths reported
220.article_body: Bengaluru reported 93 new COVID-19 infections on Friday, taking the cumulative case count to 18,72,027, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,987 in the city. The number of active cases was 2,248, while the infection positivity rate stood at 1.18%.

221.title: Congress engages in appeasement politics: K'taka CM Bommai
221.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised Congress leader Siddaramaiah for demanding a ban on the RSS, claiming that the Congress engages in appeasement politics. "Congress has no basis for asking why PFI has been banned because it was the same party that had withdrawn the cases booked against PFI...The RSS has built several institutions for the poor and downtrodden," said Bommai.

222.title: Preventive detention is a serious invasion of personal liberty: SC
222.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday observed that "preventive detention is a serious invasion of personal liberty". It said that due to this, whatever "little safeguards" the Constitution and law authorising the detention provides are of "utmost importance". The court made the observation while setting aside the preventive detention of a man under Prevention of Illicit Traffic in NDPS Act, 1988.

223.title: Mexican govt suffers major data hack; President's health issues revealed
223.article_body: The Mexican government on Friday said it had suffered a major cyber hack. The hack revealed personal details about Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador's heart condition that led to his hospitalisation in January. According to media reports, the hack accessed six terabytes of data from the Defence Ministry, including information about criminal figures, and transcripts of communications.

224.title: PM Modi skips using mic to obey loudspeaker norms, apologises to Raj rally
224.article_body: PM Narendra Modi avoided using a microphone to address a rally in Rajasthan on Friday as he reached late and said he didn't want to violate rules by using microphones and loudspeakers after 10 pm. PM Modi said, "I reached a little late. Now it's 10 pm….I apologise for the delay...I want to promise you that I'll come here again."

225.title: US imposes first-ever sanction on Indian company for oil trade with Iran
225.article_body: The US imposed sanctions on Mumbai-based petrochemical trading company Tibalaji Petrochem Private Limited on Friday for carrying out oil trade with Iran. This marks the first time that such an action has been taken against an Indian company. Tibalaji purchased "millions of dollars' worth of" petrochemical products from Iran for "onward shipment to China", the US Department of Treasury said.

226.title: India reports 3,805 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 38,293
226.article_body: India reported 3,805 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 3,947 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases in the country now stand at 38,293 following 5,069 recoveries in the last 24 hours. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 1.29%.

227.title: I'm still friends with my exes, have very good relationship with them: Rashmika
227.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said that she is still friends with her exes. "I sort of like meet their families, their present, current, future, past, everything...But I have a very good relationship with them. So that's good," she added. She also reacted to rumours about her dating actor Vijay Deverakonda and called them "cute".

228.title: Thane mechanic gets donor heart in 4 days, discharged after 2 months
228.article_body: A Maharashtra state transport mechanic from Thane got a heart in 4 days after he was put on transplant list. The 39-year-old had suffered a heart attack which had damaged 70% of his heart. Reports said that the family of a 57-year-old brain-dead woman had agreed to donate her heart to him. He was discharged from hospital on September 30.

229.title: We are taking Putin's nuclear threats very seriously: US
229.article_body: US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said that the US is taking Russian President Vladimir Putin's nuclear threats "very seriously". The US is communicating directly with Russia about the issue, including about decisive responses Washington would take if Moscow went down "that dark road", he added. Putin has warned Russia will use nuclear weapons if its "territorial integrity" is threatened.

230.title: Driver killed after tree falls on auto amid heavy rains in Pune
230.article_body: A 60-year-old autorickshaw driver was killed on Friday after a tree fell on his vehicle amid heavy rains in Pune, police said. The incident, which occurred around 4.30 pm, took place while the deceased was driving the autorickshaw, an inspector said. The fire brigade personnel were able to clear the tree to make way for traffic after two hours.

231.title: 25.76 grams of mephedrone worth ₹3.86 lakh seized in Pune, 3 arrested
231.article_body: Pune Police on Thursday arrested three men in possession of 25.76 grams of the banned drug mephedrone worth ₹3.86 lakh. The officials acted on a tip-off and arrested the accused on Shankar Sheth Road. Police also seized a two-wheeler and cell phones from them. Notably, police on Tuesday arrested two men and seized over 16 kg of opium poppy husk.

232.title: Babar Azam equals Virat Kohli's world record for being fastest to score 3,000 T20I runs
232.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has equalled former Team India captain Virat Kohli's world record for being the fastest batter to score 3,000 runs in T20I cricket. Babar reached the 3,000-run mark during his knock of 87*(59) against England in the sixth T20I. The 27-year-old took 81 innings to reach the milestone. Kohli had also taken 81 innings.

233.title: Meat shops, slaughterhouses to be shut on Gandhi Jayanti in Hyderabad
233.article_body: All meat shops will remain closed in Hyderabad on October 2 on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti, the civic body has said. The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has also ordered all sheep, goat and cow slaughterhouses to be shut that day. The 153rd birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi will be celebrated across the country on Sunday.

234.title: Gates congratulates 13-year-old bridge champion Anshul, says 'Amazed by his skill'
234.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates congratulated Anshul Bhatt, a 13-year-old from Mumbai, who became the youngest winner at the World Youth Bridge Championship in Italy last month. "I'm amazed by...Bhatt's concentration and skill...his ability to win at Bridge on the world stage," wrote Gates on LinkedIn. In a tweet, the world's fifth-richest person also referred to bridge as his "favourite pastime".

235.title: Man dies of heart attack after getting eviction notice in Ghaziabad
235.article_body: A man from Ghaziabad suffered a heart attack and died allegedly after the civic body's officials pasted an eviction notice on his house a few days ago. The notice stated that the house is dilapidated and occupants should vacate it immediately, Hindustan Times reported. A councillor said that the family is poor and he'll raise the issue before corporation officials.

236.title: India abstains from UNSC vote against Russia's 'illegal referenda' in Ukraine
236.article_body: India abstained on a draft resolution at the UN Security Council condemning Russia's "illegal referenda" and annexation of four Ukrainian territories. While 10 nations voted for the resolution, India, China, Gabon, and Brazil abstained. India's Permanent Representative to the UN, Ambassador Ruchira Kamboj, said, "We urge that all efforts are made...for...cessation of violence and hostilities."

237.title: 15 major projects stalled as Delhi govt yet to give permission: LG to CM
237.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena wrote to CM Arvind Kejriwal stating that fifteen major projects involving the felling of trees and translocation are stalled as the government is yet to give permission. "Such unwarranted delays...leading to a waste of public funds due to time and cost overruns of the projects for which accountability needs to be fixed," LG added.

238.title: Total ban on sale of meat on Gandhi Jayanti in Bengaluru: BBMP
238.article_body: There will be a total ban on sale of meat and slaughter of animals on October 2 on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti in Bengaluru, civic body BBMP has said. The 153rd birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi will be celebrated across the country that day. BBMP had previously announced a similar ban on Ganesh Chaturthi on August 31.

239.title: BMC to fix 21 worst-affected Mumbai roads in 3 months, ₹228.49 cr allocated
239.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has informed the Bombay high court (HC) that it will concretise 21 worst-affected roads in Mumbai in three months. ₹228.49 crore have been allocated for the work. ₹140.2 crore have been allocated to the western suburbs. Meanwhile, ₹47 crore has been allocated for the concretisation of the 7.2-kilometre stretch of Aarey Road.

240.title: Musk expected to unveil 1st prototype of Tesla's humanoid robot Optimus
240.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is expected to provide a new look at its humanoid robot, Optimus, at Tesla AI Day on Friday. Musk announced Tesla's plan for humanoid robots at AI Day in August 2021 and delayed this year's event to have its robot prototype working. Ahead of the event, Tesla unveiled the robot's hands in a tweet.

241.title: Ex-J'khand minister KN Tripathi files nomination for Cong Prez poll
241.article_body: Former Jharkhand minister KN Tripathi on Friday submitted his nomination papers for the Congress President election. Tripathi handed over the nomination papers to Madhusudan Mistry, Chairman of the Congress' Central Election Authority. Tripathi, a former MLA, has also served in the Indian Air Force. Shashi Tharoor and Mallikarjun Kharge have also filed their nomination papers for the election.

242.title: Gas leaks from ONGC well in Guj; people complain of eye, throat irritation
242.article_body: Several people in Kasalpura village have complained of burning sensation in their eyes and throat after gas leaked from a well of the Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) in Gujarat's Mahesana on Friday, the District Development Officer said. "Compressed air that is pumped into the well has been escaping, and the gas is not poisonous or inflammable," he added.

243.title: 15 diamonds worth ₹1 crore mined in Panna in 2 days
243.article_body: As many as 15 diamonds were mined by people in the last two days in the shallow mines of Panna in Bundelkhand region of Madhya Pradesh. The stones collectively weigh a total of 35.86 carat and will fetch around ₹1 crore during the official auction, an official said. A man named Dukman Ahirwar found six diamonds out of the 15.

244.title: Three-person panel to look into Carlsen-Niemann cheating scandal
244.article_body: The International Chess Federation (FIDE) said a three-person panel will look into world champion Magnus Carlsen's allegations that American player Hans Niemann cheated during their match. "The panel will ensure a fair ruling, protecting the rights of both parties," said the federation. Carlsen had withdrawn from the Sinquefield Cup earlier this month after losing to 19-year-old Niemann.

245.title: Red Bull, Aston Martin exceeded 2021 F1 budget cap angering Ferrari: Report
245.article_body: Red Bull and Aston Martin are two F1 teams that have reportedly exceeded the 2021 budget cap. The report says violations up to $5 million are a 'minor rule violation' and the perpetrators "may get away with a fine". Ferrari is reportedly angry as the extra money "can be worth up to half a second on the race track".

246.title: Unseeded Indian pair Rohan-Sikki enter Vietnam Open mixed doubles semis
246.article_body: Indian mixed doubles pair of Rohan Kapoor and Sikki Reddy entered the semi-final at the Vietnam Open Super 100 tournament on Friday. The unseeded Indian duo beat third seeds Chan Peng Soon and Cheah Yee See of Malaysia 21-19, 21-17 in the quarter-final. They will face top seeds Rehan Naufal Kusharjanto and Lisa Ayu Kusumawati of Indonesia in the semi-final.

247.title: Happy on winning gold medal at 36th National Games: Weightlifter Mirabai
247.article_body: After winning a gold medal at 36th National Games in Gujarat, Olympic silver medal-winning weightlifter Mirabai Chanu tweeted, "Happy on winning [the] gold medal." Mirabai, representing Manipur, won the gold with a total lift of 191 kg. She lifted 84 kg in snatch event and 107 kg in the clean and jerk event in the women's 49-kg category on Friday.

248.title: Ind team to fly to Aus ahead of T20 WC to attend special preparation camp
248.article_body: The Indian cricket team is reportedly expected to fly to Australia ahead of the ICC T20 World Cup to attend a special preparation camp. According to ESPNcricinfo, the team will go on October 6, two days after the T20I series against South Africa gets over. India is likely to train at the camp till October 13.

249.title: Chile, Peru approach CAS to bar Ecuador from 2022 FIFA World Cup
249.article_body: Chile and Peru have both appealed to the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) to bar Ecuador from the 2022 FIFA World Cup. In September, FIFA had ruled for Ecuador in a dispute over defender Byron Castillo's nationality. Chile said there is "countless proof" that Castillo was born in Colombia in July 1995 and not in Ecuador in November 1998.

250.title: Have to coach and back him; I believe in him: Man Utd's Ten Hag on Maguire
250.article_body: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag said he's "really convinced" club captain Harry Maguire will improve his form. "I have to coach him and back him. I back him because I believe in him," said Ten Hag. Adding that the player was "really good" in pre-season, Ten Hag attributed Maguire being dropped to the "good performance" of the other centre-backs.

251.title: Nitish doesn't want to be PM, opp'n unity his only agenda: Tejashwi
251.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said CM Nitish Kumar's "only agenda...right now is bringing all opposition together". "Nitish Kumar is the Chief Minister and we are working under his guidance...He has no desire to become the PM," added Tejashwi. Kumar has been making appearances with other opposition leaders to possibly create a united front for the 2024 Lok Sabha Elections.

252.title: BJP-JJP govt in Haryana pushing youth into unemployment: Cong's Hooda
252.article_body: Congress' Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Friday alleged that the BJP-JJP government in Haryana is pushing the youth into the quagmire of unemployment. Expressing concern over the "appalling unemployment" in the state, Hooda said, "On one hand, Haryana is facing an unemployment rate of 37.3%, the highest in the country, and on the other, 1.82 lakh posts are...vacant in government departments."

253.title: Clear obstructions in front of Vizhinjam Port: HC to Kerala govt
253.article_body: The Kerala High Court (HC) asked the state government on Friday to clear obstructions put up by protesters in front of the Vizhinjam Port, which is being built by Adani Ports. The coastal people are demanding an impact study be done on the multi-crore project. Adani Ports had moved the court on August 25, seeking protection from the protesters.

254.title: Court not a place for publicity: SC on rejecting plea against EVMs
254.article_body: The Supreme Court dismissed a plea which claimed electronic voting machines (EVMs) were "controlled" by companies and not the Election Commission. "It (the court) is not a place where everybody walks in just to get some publicity," said the bench. The SC also stated that the petitioner, Madhya Pradesh Jan Vikas Party, is seeking "to get recognition by filing petitions".

255.title: 18-yr-old woman going for garba chased, molested by man in Gujarat
255.article_body: A 22-year-old man allegedly chased and molested an 18-year-old woman in Gujarat's Gandhinagar when she was going to a garba venue on Tuesday night. She claimed the man tore her clothes in a bid to rape her. The venue was reportedly located near her house. The accused escaped from the scene after the woman's brother arrived upon hearing her scream.

256.title: Mother-daughter duo killed in road accident in UP
256.article_body: A mother-daughter duo was killed after the motorcycle on which they were travelling was hit by a truck from behind on a national highway in Fatehpur, UP. The deceased, Pooja (25) and her daughter Anshika (3), were being taken by Pooja's brother, Santosh Kumar, to the former's in-laws' place, police said. Notably, the accused truck driver is absconding.

257.title: 7 arrested for killing Odisha tribal man on suspicion of sorcery
257.article_body: Seven people have been arrested in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district on Friday for allegedly killing a 33-year-old tribal man on suspicion of him practising black magic, an officer said. Pandu Munda, the 33-year-old deceased, belonged to Kothabila village. Munda's wife had told the police on Pandu being missing since September 17.

258.title: Zakir Naik's staffer acquitted of radicalisation charges
258.article_body: A special NIA court acquitted Arshi Qureshi, a manager of the Islamic Research Foundation, whose President Zakir Naik was arrested in 2016 on charges of radicalising youngsters. The acquittal came due to a lack of cogent evidence. A 4,000-page chargesheet was filed against Qureshi. He was arrested, along with two others, for allegedly radicalising 22 Muslim youths to join ISIS.

259.title: UP couple die by suicide after harassment despite paying back lenders
259.article_body: A couple in UP's Shahjahanpur died by suicide after allegedly being harassed by money lenders. A suicide note alleges that although the couple paid back their two loans of ₹1 lakh and ₹1.5 lakh with interest, the lenders were pressuring them to take more loans. Police said prima facie it appears the man strangulated his wife and then hanged himself.

260.title: Govt approves release of ₹488 cr disaster fund to UP, Punjab & Goa
260.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday approved the release of ₹488 crore to Uttar Pradesh, Punjab and Goa under the State Disaster Mitigation Fund (SDMF) for the year 2021-22. The money is to be used for undertaking mitigation activities to reduce the risks from disasters. The Centre has allocated ₹32,031 crore for the SDMF for the years 2021-22 to 2025-26.

261.title: Gunfire, explosions heard near Presidential Palace in Burkina Faso
261.article_body: Heavy gunfire and a large explosion were heard near the Presidential Palace and the military junta's headquarters in Ouagadougou, the capital of Burkina Faso, on Friday, giving rise to speculation of a mutiny. Troops were deployed on the major road junctions in the city. Military leader Paul-Henri Damiba has accused some army units of creating a "confused situation".

262.title: Great deal of history will be written in the Indo-Pacific: Biden
262.article_body: US President Joe Biden said, "a great deal" of the world's history will be written in the Indo-Pacific in the coming decades. Biden made the comments as he addressed leaders of over a dozen Pacific Island nations in Washington on Thursday. "The security of America...depends on your security and the security of the Pacific," Biden told the visiting leaders.

263.title: Sri Lanka recorded 69.8% inflation in September 2022
263.article_body: Sri Lanka’s inflation hit a record high of 69.8% in September this year, the Colombo Consumer Price Index said on Friday. In August, the country recorded inflation of 64.3%. Sri Lanka is presently experiencing an extreme economic crisis, which has resulted in an acute shortage of essential items like food and medicines.

264.title: Pak PM's House 'debugged': Officials after last week’s audio leaks
264.article_body: A top Pakistani panel has completed combing and debugging the Prime Minister's House in the Islamabad Capital Territory on Friday, officials said. Purported audio clips of Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif speaking with Principal Secretary Tauqeer Shah surfaced online last week. Earlier this week, former Prime Minister Imran Khan's audio clips were also leaked online.

265.title: India-made loitering munition successfully tested in Pokhran: Report
265.article_body: An indigenous loitering munition developed by Tata Advanced Systems Limited successfully struck its targets during tests at Pokhran, said a report. The system, called ALS 50, is designed for Vertical Take Off and Landing (VTOL) and will reportedly soon be inducted into the armed forces. The bomb-carrying drone reportedly has a range of 1,000 km and a 23-kg load-carrying capacity.

266.title: John Cena sets Guinness record for most wishes granted through Make-A-Wish Foundation
266.article_body: WWE star John Cena has entered the Guinness Book of World Records for granting the most wishes through the Make-A-Wish Foundation. Cena has granted 650 wishes so far, while no other personality has granted more than 200 wishes. Make-A-Wish Foundation is a non-profit organisation through which children with a critical illness can have one of their feasible wishes fulfilled.

267.title: WADA refuses to remove marijuana from list of banned substances
267.article_body: The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) kept marijuana on its list of banned substances as the body rejected calls for change. World Athletics chief Sebastian Coe was among those who supported changing the status following sprinter Sha'Carri Richardson missing the Olympics after testing positive. WADA said removing marijuana from the list was "not supported by the experts' thorough review".

268.title: Bihar nursing home allegedly removes both kidneys of a woman
268.article_body: The Bihar Police has formed three special teams to nab the doctor and owner of a private nursing home for allegedly removing both the kidneys of a woman. The incident reportedly took place when the victim underwent a uterus-removal surgery. Doctors of a state-run hospital said more tests were needed to confirm if both her kidneys have been removed.

269.title: Indian-origin UK minister Braverman wins 1st Queen Elizabeth II award
269.article_body: UK's Indian-origin Home Secretary Suella Braverman has become the first-ever recipient of the Queen Elizabeth II Woman of the Year award. The 42-year-old Cabinet member said the award was the "honour of her life". "My mum and dad came to this country from Kenya and Mauritius in the 1960s," she said in a pre-recorded message for the award ceremony.

270.title: As a team, we are not going to analyse too much: Rohit on Bumrah
270.article_body: Indian skipper Rohit Sharma commented after pacer Jasprit Bumrah returned from an injury to the playing XI after a gap of over two months. "The back injury can be tricky. I am not going to talk too much about how he bowled...We are not going to analyse too much. Just want him to come and enjoy," Rohit said.

271.title: '21 TMC MLAs are in touch with me,' Mithun Chakraborty reiterates
271.article_body: West Bengal BJP leader Mithun Chakraborty on Saturday reiterated that 21 Trinamool Congress (TMC) MLAs are directly in touch with him. The actor-turned-politician said he is well aware of objections within BJP to inducting TMC leaders. "Many leaders have said that [BJP] won't take rotten potatoes," he added. TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh said, "TMC MLAs aren't up for sale."

272.title: Delhi records 71 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 0.81%
272.article_body: Delhi on Saturday reported 71 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 0.81%, as per the city health department. No deaths were recorded due to the infection in the national capital. The city's active case count stood at 403, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi had recorded 95 cases of the viral disease on Friday.

273.title: Egypt to bid for hosting 2036 Olympic Games: Sports Minister
273.article_body: Egyptian Sports Minister Ashraf Sobhi said that the country will apply to host the Summer Olympic Games in 2036. A statement, issued by the Egyptian cabinet, quoted IOC President Thomas Bach as saying Egypt's sports infrastructure was capable of hosting the event. Notably, if the bid turns successful then Egypt will become the first African nation to host the event.

274.title: Digvijaya Singh gets bail in defamation case over comment on RSS
274.article_body: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Saturday was granted bail in a defamation case over his claim that people associated with Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) were receiving money from Pakistani spy agency Inter-Services Intelligence. He was granted bail on a personal bond of ₹50,000. Following the bail, Singh said that as RSS wasn't a registered organisation, it couldn't be defamed.

275.title: Death toll from migrant boat capsize off Syria reaches 94
275.article_body: The death toll from a migrant boat capsize earlier this week off the Syrian coast has climbed to 94, the Syrian state media said on Saturday. The rise in death toll comes as more bodies were recovered by Syrian authorities in an operation that began on Thursday afternoon, state media reported. The migrant boat had reportedly set sail from Lebanon.

276.title: I was not copybook style: MS Dhoni on his wicketkeeping style
276.article_body: Talking about his wicketkeeping style, former India captain MS Dhoni said that he was not copybook style. Talking about Kiran More helping him out initially, Dhoni added, "He helped me a lot with my keeping, with my drills. What I really liked was, he understood my wicketkeeping technique was unique."

277.title: Japan to welcome back foreign tourists from October 11
277.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida has said his country will welcome back tourists from October 11 this year, after an over two-year-long coronavirus-forced travel suspension. "Finally, Japan will reopen the border...visa waiver is back, no daily limit and free individual visits," Japanese Digital Minister Taro Kono tweeted. Japan suspended its visa programme in March 2020 after the COVID-19 outbreak.

278.title: India create history in Jhulan's last match, whitewash England in ODIs at their home
278.article_body: India created history on Saturday by completing a women's ODI series whitewash against England on England soil for the first time ever. India defeated England by 16 runs in the third ODI. India were bowled out for 169 runs, while England were dismissed for 153 runs. Jhulan Goswami, who was featuring in her last international match, took two wickets.

279.title: Hope to make hockey World Cup debut in Odisha next year: Abhishek
279.article_body: Indian men's hockey team forward Abhishek, who was part of India's silver medal-winning team at Commonwealth Games 2022, said he hopes he can make his World Cup debut in Odisha in January next year. "And I hope to make it a pleasant memory as well. It'll be a lot of fun in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela at...World Cup 2023," he added.

280.title: 730 detained in anti-mobilisation protests across Russia: Rights group
280.article_body: At least 730 people were detained across Russia on Saturday at protests against Kremlin's military mobilisation order, a rights group cited by Reuters said. The OVD-Info protest monitoring group said it was aware of detentions in 32 different cities. Earlier this week, President Vladimir Putin ordered Russia's first military draft since World War 2 for the conflict in Ukraine.

281.title: 2021 US Open champion Raducanu retires from semi-final in Korea
281.article_body: World number 77 Emma Raducanu was forced to retire from the Hana Bank Korea Open semi-final against Jelena Ostapenko on Saturday due to a left glute injury. The 19-year-old, who was playing in her first semi-final since winning US Open last year, was down 4-6, 6-3, 3-0 when she retired. Top seed Ostapenko will face Ekaterina Alexandrova in Sunday's final.

282.title: Cong in Karnataka is united, BJP engaged in propaganda war: Khader
282.article_body: Congress MLA UT Khader said that the Karnataka unit of the party is united and the ruling BJP is engaged in a propaganda war. Senior state Congress leaders, DK Shivakumar and Siddaramaiah, are having a cordial relationship, Khader said. He added that the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is aimed at building bonds of friendship among the people of all states.

283.title: Half of judiciary's issues are state-sponsored litigations: Ex-CJI
283.article_body: Former CJI NV Ramana said half of the judiciary's problems would be resolved if the government puts a halt to state-sponsored litigations. "Inter-departmental disputes, service matters and those relating to the inaction of authorities clogging the system are appalling," said Ramana. He added that the judicial infrastructure in the country even after 75 years of independence was 'disturbing'.

284.title: I was about to vomit: Falguni on remixed version of her song 'Maine Payal Hai Chhankai'
284.article_body: Talking about her first reaction to the remixed version of her song 'Maine Payal Hai Chhankai' sung by Neha Kakkar, Falguni Pathak said, "I was about to vomit." She added, "The video and picturization had such innocence but they have ruined it." She further said, "If you want to reach out to...younger generation, change...rhythm of...song, but don’t make it cheap."

285.title: Woman gets her husband married to his ex-lover in Andhra, trio to live together
285.article_body: A woman in Andhra Pradesh officiated the wedding of her husband with his former partner in a traditional ceremony at a temple in Tirupati. Kalyan, who was married to Vimala, came in contact with his ex Nitya Sree recently and Kalyan and Nitya convinced Vimala to agree to their marriage. The trio will reportedly live together in the same house.

286.title: Jhulan gets guard of honour by England players in last match of her career, video viral
286.article_body: India pacer Jhulan Goswami got a guard of honour by England players while coming out to bat in last match of her career. England Cricket tweeted, "For over 20 years Jhulan has run in...hit a length and blazed a trail...She has bowled nearly 10,000 balls in ODIs...and she may just have inspired as many young girls to try cricket."

287.title: Won't ever comment on Verstappen's driving or personality: Hamilton
287.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver Lewis Hamilton refused to speak about current world champion Max Verstappen's personality and driving. "I won't ever comment on either of those," said Hamilton when asked during a video wherein other F1 drivers spoke highly of Verstappen. Recently, Red Bull team principal Christian Horner accused Hamilton of "never once" recognising "Max's ability".

288.title: 3, including 2 Iranian tourists, injured in road accident in UP
288.article_body: Three persons, including two Iranian tourists, were injured when the mini-bus they were travelling in rammed into a vehicle ahead of it on Yamuna Expressway in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday, police said. The injured were identified as 35-year-old Aafia and 30-year-old Ilhan. There were 17 foreign tourists who were going to Agra to visit the Taj Mahal and other monuments.

289.title: Activists stage protest against Kerala dog killings at Delhi's Jantar Mantar
289.article_body: Animal rights activists, including several children and youths, staged a peaceful protest at Delhi's Jantar Mantar on Saturday against killing of street dogs in Kerala. They alleged that despite Supreme Court's orders to protect dogs, they are being killed mercilessly. Several cases of dogs being poisoned, beaten, and burned alive amid rising dog bite incidents in Kerala have come up.

290.title: Bids invited for bullet train project tunnel passing under sea
290.article_body: The National High Speed Rail Corporation has invited bids for constructing a 21-km underground tunnel as part of the Ahmedabad-Mumbai bullet train project. A 7-km stretch of the tunnel will be constructed under the sea, making it a complex engineering work. This is the third time bids are being invited for the project after failed attempts in 2019 and 2021.

291.title: Video of 'Shaka Laka...' actor shooting with magic pencil surfaces, fans react
291.article_body: A video of 'Shaka Laka Boom Boom' actor Kinshuk Vaidya filming with the 'magic pencil' from the show has surfaced online. In the video, shared by photographer Viral Bhayani, Kinshuk could be seen trying to bring something to life with the pencil. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Childhood memories," while another commented, "Ohh my god...is it coming again??"

292.title: Power gone into heads of BJP leaders: AAP MLA on Ankita murder case
292.article_body: AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj has called the murder of 19-year-old Ankita Bhandari an extremely shameful act. BJP leader Vinod Arya's son has been arrested in the case. Bharadwaj claimed the murder was the result of power going into BJP leaders' heads. "BJP is so intoxicated in power that even a small [BJP] leader...believes that he rules the country," he added.

293.title: India & other Quad nations commit to expanding UN Security Council
293.article_body: The Quadrilateral Security Dialogue or Quad has committed to expanding the permanent and non-permanent seats of the UN Security Council (UNSC). In a joint statement, the Foreign Ministers of India, Japan, Australia and the US said reforming the world body would help reflect the "current global realities". Earlier, US President Joe Biden said the UNSC should be reformed.

294.title: KRK says he will quit reviewing films after 'Vikram Vedha'
294.article_body: Actor and film critic Kamaal Rashid Khan aka KRK tweeted on Saturday that he'll not be reviewing films after 'Vikram Vedha'. "Thanks to all...Bollywood people...for not accepting me as...critic but filing so many cases against me to stop my reviews," he added. KRK was arrested over derogatory tweet and molestation cases on August 30. He was later released on bail.

295.title: Indian football team held to 1-1 draw by lower ranked Singapore
295.article_body: Indian men's football team played out a 1-1 draw with Singapore at the Hung Thinh Friendly Football Tournament in Vietnam. Singapore, the 159th ranked team, opened the scoring in the 37th minute as India hit back with an Ashique Kuruniyan equaliser six minutes later. "There are many things that we could have done better," said Sunil Chhetri after the match.

296.title: Indian partition was irrational, done in hurry: Ram Madhav
296.article_body: RSS leader Ram Madhav said that the partition of India, which led to the creation of Pakistan, was irrational and was done in a hurry. "Mahatma Gandhi may not be fully absolved of the sequence of events ending in the tragic partition...but it will be unfair to blame one man who represented many lofty ideals and inspired generations," Madhav said.

297.title: Piyush Goyal discusses bilateral ties with Singaporean minister
297.article_body: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal met Tharman Shanmugaratnam, Singapore Senior Minister and Coordinating Minister for Social Policies, during his visit to the island nation on Saturday. "Discussed strengthening bilateral cooperation across several areas of mutual interest," Goyal tweeted. Later, Goyal held a roundtable with business executives and investors.

298.title: One more arrested in Amritsar IED case for arranging motorcycle
298.article_body: One more person was arrested for his alleged involvement in planting an IED under the car of a Punjab Police sub-inspector in Amritsar, police said on Saturday. The arrested man has been identified as Satnam Singh alias Honey. He is suspected of providing a motorcycle to the accused person who was arrested earlier for planting the explosive device, police added.

299.title: Kejriwal, Mann to visit Ahmedabad tomorrow ahead of Gujarat polls
299.article_body: Senior Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leaders Arvind Kejriwal and Bhagwant Mann will visit Ahmedabad on Sunday in preparation for the Gujarat elections. “Will interact with youth, safai karamcharis and temporary employees there. Every section of Gujarat considers the Aam Aadmi Party as their hope,” Kejriwal tweeted. Ahead of the assembly polls, Kejriwal has been travelling to the state every week.

300.title: Iran planning 'proportional' response to Ukraine downgrading ties
300.article_body: Iran is planning a "proportional" response to Ukraine downgrading ties with the country over "unconfirmed reports" of drone sales to Russia, Tehran said on Saturday. Kyiv on Friday said that it would revoke the Iranian ambassador's accreditation over Tehran's decision to supply Russian forces with drones. The staff strength at the Iranian embassy would also be significantly downsized, Kyiv added.

301.title: Pant is a predetermined, premeditated cricketer: Gavaskar
301.article_body: Former Indian skipper Sunil Gavaskar said that wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant needs to develop his "off-side game". "Pant is a predetermined, premeditated cricketer. He decides quite often what he is going to do before the ball is bowled," Gavaskar said. "That's why he gets into trouble as he looks for something which is not there," the 73-year-old former cricketer added.

302.title: BJP appoints Shiv Bakshi as Parliamentary Party Office Secretary
302.article_body: The BJP has appointed Shiv Shakti Nath Bakshi as the party's new Parliamentary Party Office Secretary. BJP General Secretary and Headquarters In-charge Arun Singh passed an order with regard to the appointment. Bakshi is the current National Convenor of the BJP Journals and Publication Department. He is also the Executive Editor of BJP's mouthpiece Kamal Sandesh.

303.title: Divisive & communal organisations should be banned: Maha Cong Prez
303.article_body: Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole on Saturday demanded a ban on Popular Front of India (PFI), which is under the scanner for allegedly supporting terror activities. "Divisive and communal organisations should be banned. The Congress wants peace and such tendencies to create a divide should be stopped," he said. Patole criticised the alleged raising of 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans in Pune.

304.title: School principal shot at by Class 12 student in UP; critical
304.article_body: A Class 12 student of Adarsh Ramswaroop Inter College in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur district allegedly shot at the school's principal on the campus on Saturday. The 48-year-old principal, who was shot twice in the stomach, is stated to be in a critical condition. Police said the shooting came a day after the victim scolded two Class 12 students for fighting.

305.title: They're trying to make me a prostitute: U'khand resort receptionist texted friend
305.article_body: Uttarakhand resort receptionist Ankita Bhandari had sent her friend a text message, before her death, saying, "They are trying to turn me into a prostitute." Bhandari was working at a resort owned by ex-BJP leader Vinod Arya's son Pulkit, who's been accused of murdering her. She reportedly alleged she was being forced to provide "special services" to guests for ₹10,000.

306.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till September 27, list released
306.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued a heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs till September 27. Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura may witness heavy rainfall across the next three days. Odisha may witness heavy rainfall on September 27. Meanwhile, heavy rainfall is expected over Himachal Pradesh, Bihar, Uttarakhand, West Bengal and Sikkim on September 25.

307.title: Will present world-class VFX in 'Krrish 4': Rakesh Roshan
307.article_body: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan said to compete with Hollywood, he has no choice but to present world-class VFX in 'Krrish 4'. "They've been using VFX for so many years. So their way of working, understanding is faster and so is their visualisation," he said. He also promised to treat the audience with a lot of special effects in 'Krrish 4'.

308.title: We're trying to be a bit more aggressive upfront: Aaron Finch
308.article_body: After losing the second T20I to India on Friday, Australian captain Aaron Finch said that their side is trying to play with an aggressive approach. "It's important that you're always looking at ways to improve and obviously, we went with [Glenn] Maxwell at three, Tim David at four, so we're trying to be a bit more aggressive upfront," Finch said.

309.title: Arsenal have good chance to win Premier League this season: Ex-manager Wenger
309.article_body: Former manager Arsene Wenger has said Arsenal have a "good chance" to win the Premier League title this season in the absence of a "super dominating" team. With 18 points from opening seven matches of the season, Arsenal are currently on top of the standings. Both defending champions Manchester City and Tottenham Hotspur are one point behind Arsenal.

310.title: 2 labourers from Bihar injured after terrorists open fire in J&K's Pulwama
310.article_body: Two labourers from Bihar suffered injuries after terrorists opened fire on them in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Saturday evening. Police said the labourers have been shifted to a hospital, where their condition is stated to be stable. As per reports, the incident took place in the Ratnipora area of Pulwama.

311.title: Broad reacts to pic of Federer, Nadal crying, says 'Me, when Jimmy retires in 2053'
311.article_body: England fast bowler Stuart Broad took to his Instagram Stories to react to the picture of Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal crying after Federer's last-ever professional match. "Me, when Jimmy (James Anderson) retires in 2053," he wrote. Federer played his last tennis match by teaming up with Rafael Nadal for a doubles match in Laver Cup.

312.title: J’khand CM’s aide ran illegal mining operation worth ₹1,000 cr: ED
312.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has told the PMLA Court in Ranchi that CM Hemant Soren’s MLA representative Pankaj Mishra was managing an illegal mining operation worth over ₹1,000 crore in Jharkhand’s Sahibganj district and adjacent areas. The ED has named Mishra and his associates Bacchu Yadav and Prem Prakash as accused. All the accused are in judicial custody.

313.title: CBI arrests ex-Mumbai Police chief in NSE phone tapping case
313.article_body: The CBI on Saturday arrested former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey after a Delhi court granted a four-day remand of Pandey to the probe agency in connection with the National Stock Exchange (NSE) phone tapping case. It is alleged that Pandey's company iSec Services Private Limited, along with others, illegally intercepted and recorded calls by various NSE officials from 2009-2017.

314.title: Axar Patel can bowl in any stage, gives advantage: Rohit Sharma
314.article_body: After Indian spinner Axar Patel picked up two wickets against Australia in the 2nd T20I on Friday, skipper Rohit Sharma spoke about the importance of the 28-year-old bowler in the team. "Axar can bowl in any stage, which gives me an advantage of using the other bowlers in different situations too...maybe use the pacers in the middle overs," Rohit said.

315.title: Harmeet Desai wins men's singles TT title at National Games
315.article_body: Table tennis player Harmeet Desai beat Soumyajit Ghosh 11-8, 11-4, 11-7, 11-8 to win men's singles title at 36th National Games in Surat on Saturday. "My goal is to be...top-ranked Indian player while also entering the top-50 of world rankings," said Desai. The 29-year-old is currently ranked 124th in the world, while Sathiyan Gnanasekaran is the top-ranked Indian at 37.

316.title: Premeditated: CM on violence during PFI's hartal in Kerala
316.article_body: Kerala witnessed premeditated violence during the hartal led by the Popular Front of India (PFI) on Friday, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said on Saturday. Stating that it was an attempt to destroy the peaceful atmosphere of the state, Vijayan added that the culprits will not be spared. He noted that the violence resulted in destruction of public and private properties.

317.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Gorkha' to go on floors in 2023: Reports
317.article_body: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Gorkha' will reportedly go on the floors next year. According to reports, the scripting of the film is likely to be completed by March 2023. The makers are trying to make the film "as authentic as possible", reports said. 'Gorkha', based on the life of Major General Ian Cardozo, will be directed by Sanjay Puran Singh Chauhan.

318.title: Will target those chanting 'Pak Zindabad' during Pune PFI stir: Rane
318.article_body: Maharashtra BJP MLA Nitesh Rane promised action over reports of 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans being raised during protests supporting PFI in Pune and said 'each will be targeted'. "To all those shouting Pakistan Zindabad slogans in support of PFI in Pune...Chun chun ke marenge...Itna yaad rakhna!!! (We will catch and strike each one of you...remember this)," tweeted Rane.

319.title: India's 1st radar to detect avalanche in 3 seconds installed in Sikkim
319.article_body: The Indian Army and Defence Geoinformatics Research Establishment (DGRE) have jointly installed an Avalanche Monitoring Radar in north Sikkim. The radar is the first of its kind in India and can detect avalanches within three seconds of their trigger. It uses a series of short microwave pulses scattered at the target to detect the avalanche.

320.title: Kartik is a director's actor, his intensity in 'Freddy' shocked me: Director
320.article_body: 'Freddy' director Shashanka Ghosh called Kartik Aaryan a director's actor and said, "His intensity in the film shocked me." "Off-screen, he comes across as a handsome and easy-going guy. But when the camera rolls, he is immersed in his role," he added. "Kartik told me that he is losing sleep because of what he was playing in 'Freddy'," said Shashanka.

321.title: Opposition leaders 'chronic liars': Punjab CM Mann
321.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday criticised Opposition leaders, calling them "chronic liars" and also accused them of being habitual of finding faults in every pro-people initiative of his government. Speaking at Faridkot, he said due to a dearth of any concrete issues, these leaders are criticising the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government only for the sake of criticism.

322.title: Punjab will get its first sign language centre in Patiala: Minister
322.article_body: Punjab Health and Family Welfare Minister Chetan Singh Jouramajra on Saturday announced that Punjab government will open the state's first centre for teaching sign language at Patiala. Attending a function organised by Patiala Association of Deaf, he said the Punjab government is not only providing special job opportunities to such people, but also taking steps to empower all the disabled.

323.title: Samruddhi Expressway will change the face of Vidarbha: Fadnavis
323.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said the Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi Expressway will change the face of Vidarbha. "It will become the next economic corridor of the country," Fadnavis said. He said there were plans to develop connectivity between Nagpur and Goa on the lines of the Samruddhi Expressway that links Vidarbha's largest city with Mumbai.

324.title: Pic shows Sule sitting on CM's chair; NCP says 'morphed', files complaint
324.article_body: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Saturday accused the spokesperson of the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena faction of sharing a "morphed" picture of Baramati MP Supriya Sule sitting in the CM's chair. The NCP has filed a complaint with police and demanded appropriate action against the concerned Twitter handle used for posting Sule's picture and the person who posted it.

325.title: Damn you Roger, will be walking with swollen eyes for whole weekend: Kim
325.article_body: Four-time Grand Slam champion Kim Clijsters took to Twitter after Roger Federer played the last match of his career and wrote, "Damn you Roger...will be walking around with swollen eyes for the whole weekend." Federer played a doubles match alongside Rafael Nadal for Team Europe at Laver Cup. "What an emotional night! One and only Roger Federer!" tweeted Caroline Wozniacki.

326.title: Police officer attacked by cannabis smugglers; critically injured
326.article_body: A Karnataka Police inspector was attacked by a mob of over 30 smugglers after the official and his team recovered a consignment of cannabis, a senior police officer said on Saturday. Inspector Srimant Illal sustained grievous injuries in the attack that took place on the Karnataka-Maharashtra border, police said. He is reportedly undergoing treatment and is in critical condition.

327.title: Female student filmed by her batchmates while changing clothes in MP, blackmailed
327.article_body: Three male students of Bhopal's Industrial Training Institute (ITI) allegedly recorded a video of one of their female batchmates, while she was changing clothes, police said. They later showed the clip to her friend and allegedly demanded around ₹5,000 to not leak it on social media, police said. One of the accused students' was arrested.

328.title: 32-yr-old ASHA worker from Kashmir donates blood 28 times since 2012
328.article_body: A 32-year-old Accredited Social Health Activist (ASHA) from Kashmir has donated blood 28 times since 2012, reports said. Bilqees Ara, who is known as 'blood woman of Kashmir', said she's proud to be the saviour of patients. "I've donated blood to...accident victims, pregnant ladies and other patients in almost every hospital in North Kashmir," the mother of three children added.

329.title: Army man who blackmailed Chandigarh University student to leak videos arrested
329.article_body: An Army personnel, who allegedly blackmailed a Chandigarh University female student to leak objectionable videos of other female students, was arrested on Saturday. The accused, identified as Sanjeev Singh, was arrested from Sela Pass, Arunachal Pradesh, officials said. So far four people, including the female student, have been arrested in connection to the leak of the videos.

330.title: India's 18-year-old Grandmaster Nihal Sarin defeats former world chess champion Kramnik
330.article_body: India's 18-year-old Grandmaster Nihal Sarin defeated ex-world chess champion Vladimir Kramnik in round of 32 of the 2022 Chess.com Global Championship. Nihal won the match with a margin of 2.5-0.5. Nihal will now face world number two Ding Liren in the round of 16. Meanwhile, India's 16-year-old Grandmaster Raunak Sadhwani crashed out of the tournament after losing to Anish Giri.

331.title: Don't worry, BJP will be wiped out: Lalu Yadav ahead of Delhi visit
331.article_body: RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav, ahead of his Delhi visit to meet Congress President Sonia Gandhi, claimed that the BJP would be "wiped out". Yadav's response came when he asked about Home Minister Amit Shah's rally in Bihar's Purnea. Lalu, after his meeting in Delhi, will also attend a rally in Haryana by former CM Om Prakash Chautala.

332.title: VHP protests outside UK Embassy over attacks on Indians in Britain
332.article_body: Members of Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Saturday gathered outside the UK Embassy in Delhi to protest against the attacks on Indians in Britain's Leicester, Birmingham and Smethwick. They were protesting in an effort to meet embassy officials. Earlier, VHP wrote a letter to UK PM Liz Truss saying that Hindus and their places of worship were targeted by extremists.

333.title: Congress won't retain Kerala LS seats it won in 2019: CM Vijayan
333.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said the Congress party will not be able to retain the Lok Sabha seats it won during the 2019 Parliamentary elections in the state. Vijayan said Congress MPs, including Rahul Gandhi, have failed to 'resist' the BJP at the national level. He added that people last time voted for Rahul thinking he would become the PM.

334.title: Rakhi Sawant is next: Hema Malini on Kangana reportedly fighting Mathura polls
334.article_body: BJP MP Hema Malini responded to speculation that actor Kangana Ranaut may contest elections from her constituency in UP's Mathura and said, "Tomorrow, even Rakhi Sawant will [fight polls]." Malini further said, "So you won't even consider a local...You want only film stars in Mathura?" Ranaut earlier this week visited shrines in Vrindavan along with her family and offered prayers.

335.title: Woman dies due to power cut at hospital during C-section in Tamil Nadu
335.article_body: A 22-year-old woman reportedly died following a power outage during C-section at a government hospital in Tamil Nadu's Annur. According to police, the non-functioning of generator led to complications, forcing the doctors to shift her to a private hospital. She gave birth to a boy, who is fine, but after delivery, her condition deteriorated and she died.

336.title: 2 chefs of Guj girls' school held for sexually harassing students
336.article_body: Two chefs of a residential girls' school in Gujarat's Valsad district were arrested on Saturday for allegedly sexually harassing and verbally abusing tribal girl students. The principal and all seven chefs of the residential school have been transferred to other schools. The arrests came after the principal of the school lodged a complaint with the police against the accused.

337.title: Teaser of Varun's Bhediya to be shown before Vikram Vedha in cinemas: Reports
337.article_body: The teaser of Varun Dhawan and Kriti Sanon's 'Bhediya' will be shown before the shows of 'Vikram Vedha' in cinemas, according to reports. The Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan-starrer film will hit the screens on September 30. 'Bhediya', also starring Abhishek Banerjee and Deepak Dobriyal, is a horror-comedy film directed by Amar Kaushik.

338.title: Wrestler Bajrang Punia withdraws from National Games due to head injury
338.article_body: Olympic bronze medallist Bajrang Punia has withdrawn from upcoming 36th National Games due to a head injury sustained during the recently concluded World Wrestling Championships in Serbia. "It's unfortunate that it happened so close to the event. The cut is fresh...will take time to heal," said Bajrang. The 28-year-old won a bronze medal in men's 65-kg category at World Championships.

339.title: Our forest cover has increased, wetlands also expanding rapidly: PM
339.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated the National Conference of Environment Ministers in Gujarat's Ekta Nagar via video conferencing. He said that India is a rapidly developing economy, which is also continuously strengthening its ecology. "Today's new India is moving ahead with new thinking [and] new approach...Our forest cover has increased and wetlands are also expanding rapidly," he added.

340.title: Jammu's mayor and deputy mayor resign following BJP meet
340.article_body: The mayor and deputy mayor of the BJP-led Jammu Municipal Corporation (JMC) on Saturday resigned from their posts following a meeting with party corporators and leaders. Mayor Chander Mohan Gupta and his deputy Purnima Sharma stepped down voluntarily, J&K BJP President Ravinder Raina said. The party will choose the next mayor and their deputy after consulting its corporators, Raina said.

341.title: Great white shark draws 'self-portrait' with its path in the ocean, pic surfaces
341.article_body: A great white shark fitted with a GPS tracker appeared to draw a self-portrait with its path in the Atlantic Ocean, experts have said. The shark named Breton was fitted with a tracker in 2020 as part of a research programme in Nova Scotia. Its movements, spanning a total of 444 days, appeared to draw the outline of a shark.

342.title: Harmanpreet breaks down ahead of Jhulan Goswami's last international match, video viral
342.article_body: India Women captain Harmanpreet Kaur broke down ahead of fast bowler Jhulan Goswami's last international match on Saturday. A video has gone viral showing Harmanpreet getting emotional and hugging Jhulan as the team felicitated her ahead of the ODI against England at Lord's. Harmanpreet also honoured Jhulan by going for the toss with her.

343.title: Japan ex-PM Abe’s funeral to cost more than UK Queen's funeral: Reports
343.article_body: Former Japanese PM Shinzo Abe's state funeral will cost more than UK's Queen Elizabeth II's recent state funeral, reports have said. Abe's funeral expenses are estimated to go up to 1.66 billion yen (around ₹94 crore), as against the reported cost of the Queen's funeral of 1.3 billion yen (around ₹74 crore). People have protested the funeral's high cost.

344.title: Mom didn't want me to become actor after dad's death: Gulshan's daughter
344.article_body: Actress Khushali Kumar, daughter of late Gulshan Kumar, revealed that her mother got very scared after Gulshan's death. "She didn't want to put anyone of us before...camera...Mumma told us, 'No matter what you do, do it behind...camera.' Convincing her was a process," said Khushali, who was recently seen in Madhavan-starrer 'Dhokha'. Gulshan was shot dead in Mumbai in August 1997.

345.title: Stern action against those who raised 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans: Fadnavis
345.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said that stern action will be taken against those who raised 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans in Pune. "We will find them and take action against them," Fadnavis said. His comment comes after a video of protesters purportedly raising 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans during a Popular Front of India (PFI) protest in Pune surfaced online.

346.title: BJP, RSS nervous due to Cong's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Jairam Ramesh
346.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Saturday claimed the BJP and RSS are nervous due to 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which has forced the RSS chief to reach out to various sections of society. "This is the effect of our initiative," Ramesh said. Speaking about RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's visit to a mosque in Delhi, he said, "Bhagwat's visit was...a publicity stunt."

347.title: MP CM scolds official on stage over negligence, says 'you're suspended'
347.article_body: A government official was publicly scolded by Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan for failing to issue an adequate number of cards under the Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana. The CM called the official on stage during a programme and asked him to explain what went wrong. "Go, you're suspended," Chouhan was purportedly heard saying, after speaking to the official.

348.title: Amit Shah to embark on a 3-day visit to J&K from Sept 30
348.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah will be on a three-day visit to Jammu and Kashmir from September 30, where he is scheduled to address two rallies and review developmental activities. However, Jammu and Kashmir BJP General Secretary Sunil Sharma said the visit should not be linked to Assembly elections. "It will be...[Shah's] direct dialogue with the people of Kashmir," Sharma said.
