349.title: Bengaluru woman robbed of ₹2 lakh in cyber fraud; amount recovered later
349.article_body: After losing ₹2 lakh in online fraud, the victim, Veena Chaturvedi, got her lost amount back within 10 days after filing the complaint. Veena is the mother of Bengaluru-based comedian Jagdish Chaturvedi. "My mother had received a message from an HDFC look-alike number that said her net banking will be frozen if she doesn't verify her PAN immediately," Jagdish said.

350.title: When I hear Federer's name, I get nightmares: Ex world no. 1 Roddick
350.article_body: Paying tribute to 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer following his last career match at Laver Cup, ex-world number one Andy Roddick said, "When I hear the name of Roger, I get nightmares because he gave me nightmares for so long." Nick Kyrgios said, "He is the Michael Jordan of tennis. I think, without Roger, there's no GOAT to chase."

351.title: Argentina defeat Honduras by 3-0; Messi scores twice
351.article_body: Argentina defeated Honduras by 3-0 in a friendly game in Miami on Friday. Forward Lionel Messi scored two goals with one of them coming from a penalty strike. The match was part of the preparation for the two teams ahead of this year's FIFA World Cup in Qatar. Argentina will play their next friendly game against Jamaica on Tuesday.

352.title: 3 rare migratory birds sighted in Gurugram
352.article_body: Three migratory coastal birds, which are typically not seen in the National Capital Region, have been sighted in Gurugram's Chandu Budhera, said ornithophile Kavi Nanda. He sighted the bar-tailed godwit last week, the common ringed plover and red-necked phalarope this week. It is believed that rough weather changed the course of these birds who were flying in from Siberia.

353.title: ₹100-crore Jagannath Temple in WB's Digha to be complete by 2023
353.article_body: The ₹100-crore Jagannath Temple being built by the West Bengal government in Digha will be completed by December 2023, an official said on Saturday. The temple, resembling the centuries-old Jagannath Temple in Odisha's Puri, is being built on a 20-acre plot near the Old Digha beach. The 65-metre-high temple will have idols of Lord Jagannath, Lord Balabhadra and Goddess Subhadra.

354.title: Tender floated to procure 3,980 electric buses for Delhi
354.article_body: Convergence Energy Services Limited, a subsidiary under the Union Power Ministry, has floated a tender to procure 3,980 electric buses for Delhi. The tender was floated on September 21. Valued at around ₹5,000 crore, the tender aims to procure 5,690 electric buses. Other than Delhi, the remaining buses are for Haryana, Telangana, Arunachal Pradesh and Gujarat states.

355.title: Part of hill collapses in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh; 40 stranded
355.article_body: A massive landslide in Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh blocked the Tawaghat-Lipulekh highway after part of a hill collapsed near Najang Tamba on Friday evening. At least 40 pilgrims, who undertook the Adi Kailash Mansarovar Yatra, along with local residents are reportedly stranded due to the closure of the highway. No casualties have been reported in the incident so far.

356.title: Aaron Finch's reaction after getting clean bowled on Jasprit Bumrah's yorker goes viral
356.article_body: A video of Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch's reaction after getting clean bowled on India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah's yorker in the second T20I in Nagpur has gone viral. In the video, Finch can be seen applauding Bumrah for this delivery. Finch was dismissed for 31(15). India went on to win the match by six wickets.

357.title: What is CBI's 'Operation Megha Chakra' against child porn?
357.article_body: CBI has launched a nationwide operation code-named 'Operation Megha Chakra', aimed at cracking down on the circulation of child pornography and those circulating it. The name indicates the alleged offences of downloading and distributing Child Sexual Exploitation Material (CSEM) via 'Cloud Space'. Raids were carried out in Delhi, UP, Bihar, Punjab, Haryana, Maharashtra, Gujarat and other states.

358.title: Week-long 'Infinite Library' project begins in Pune
358.article_body: The Max Mueller Bhavan began showcasing on Saturday a week-long 'Infinite Library' project in Pune. The project aims to show libraries of the future using a virtual reality installation. Creative Director of 'Infinite Library' Mika Johnson said the project "will help to reimagine history and understand interrelations". The project can be viewed free of cost but pre-registration is mandatory.

359.title: Rafael Nadal pulls out of Laver Cup due to personal reasons
359.article_body: Rafael Nadal has pulled out of Laver Cup due to personal reasons. This comes after he teamed up with Roger Federer for a doubles match for Team Europe against Team World. "I'm not doing well. It's been a tough time for me, I hardly slept...I was stressful," Nadal said after the match, which was the last match of Federer's career.

360.title: I'm getting to fulfil my childhood dream in 'Code Name: Tiranga': Parineeti
360.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra, who'll play an agent in the upcoming film 'Code Name: Tiranga', said, "Growing up, I fantasised being an agent for my country." She added that she used to carry a toy gun and pretend she was the best agent in service of the country. "So, I'm getting to fulfil my childhood dream in [the film]," said Parineeti.

361.title: Tenders invited to build underground tunnel for Mumbai-Ahmedabad corridor
361.article_body: Tenders have been invited to build a 7-km-long tunnel under the sea, a first of its kind in the country. This will be part of the 21-km-long tunnel, which will be built in Maharashtra for the Mumbai-Ahmedabad High-Speed Rail Corridor. The tunnel will be between the Bandra-Kurla Complex underground station and Shilphata in Maharashtra.

362.title: Man steals 30 motorcycles in B'luru to pay gambling debts, arrested
362.article_body: A professional photographer has been arrested for allegedly stealing around 30 motorcycles in Bengaluru and selling them in his hometown in Tumakuru to pay gambling debts. N Sridhar alias Chingari used to steal motorcycles parked on roadsides in residential localities whenever he faced a financial crisis, police said. He would reportedly wear a helmet to avoid being stopped by police.

363.title: Over 38,000 FYJC seats vacant after 5 rounds of admissions in Pune
363.article_body: After three regular and two special sessions of admissions for first-year junior college (FYJC), 38,255 seats remained vacant in the Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad regions. Assistant Director of Education, Pune, Meena Shendkar said students must be careful before cancelling their seats as there may be no more rounds for admission. Colleges will release the list of admitted students on September 25.

364.title: Mom & dad were very protective, we lived an insular life: Shweta Bachchan
364.article_body: Amitabh and Jaya Bachchan's daughter Shweta Bachchan has said she grew up in a protective environment. She also revealed that she and her brother Abhishek Bachchan were kept away from the glamour world during their growing-up years. "We...didn't understand much of what was going on out there...We never had magazines at home...TV in...80s was minimal...We lived...[an] insular life," Shweta added.

365.title: University of Hyderabad students protest against exam fees hike
365.article_body: University of Hyderabad (UoH) students on Friday protested against hike in examination fees and raised slogans outside the office of Controller of Examinations (CoE) on campus. Shiva Durga Rao, secretary of the Students Federation of India (SFI) on campus, said examination fees were hiked from ₹600 to ₹4,000. Rao said the security guards manhandled students when they were protesting peacefully.

366.title: Rohit was brilliant, Axar was the difference: Finch on 2nd T20I loss
366.article_body: Following Australia's six-wicket loss against India in second T20I, Australia captain Aaron Finch said India captain Rohit Sharma's "brilliant" knock of 20-ball 46* and two overs bowled by Axar Patel made the difference. Axar posted bowling figures of 2-0-13-2. Match was reduced to eight overs per side amid wet outfield. India chased down the 91-run target in 7.2 overs.

367.title: 77-yr-old yoga tutor jailed for sexually abusing 5-yr-old girl in B'luru
367.article_body: A 77-year-old yoga tutor has been sentenced to five years in prison for sexually assaulting a five-year-old student in Bengaluru. The incident took place in August 2018. The minor's mother had sent her to a guest room in the yoga centre to collect some books when the convict, who was alone inside, locked the door and sexually assaulted her.

368.title: 'Model of fraud': Congress on Delhi govt's education model
368.article_body: The Congress party on Saturday said the education model being promoted by the AAP-led Delhi government is a "model of fraud". The party added that if the "so-called education model" is replicated in other states, the entire education system will be "ruined". Congress claimed that its government built 150 schools in Delhi whereas Arvind Kejriwal's government hardly built 20 schools.

369.title: 30-yr-old man strangles live-in partner to death in Thane; arrested
369.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly strangling his 24-year-old live-in partner to death in Bhiwandi town of Thane district in Maharashtra. He was arrested by police while transporting the woman's body in an ambulance. The accused has been identified as Saddam Sharif Sayyed, a resident of Kalyan.

370.title: Must 'deal decisively': Iran's Prez on protests over Amini's death
370.article_body: Iran must "deal decisively with those who oppose the country's security and tranquillity", Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi said on Saturday while speaking about the protests which erupted following the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini. She was allegedly assaulted by Iranian police over "improper hijab". At least 35 people have been killed in demonstrations against Amini's death across Iran.

371.title: Hyderabad to become 1st city to treat 100% sewage by 2023: KT Rama Rao
371.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao monitored the progress of the construction of Sewage Treatment Plants (STPs) across various sites in Hyderabad on Saturday. "STPs with 1,259 MLD (Million Litres per Day) capacity of treatment will be completed by summer 2023, making Hyderabad probably the first city to treat 100% of its sewerage," he tweeted, sharing photos from the site.

372.title: CBI launches massive crackdown on child porn, raids 56 places across India
372.article_body: The CBI on Saturday raided 56 places across 19 states and one Union Territory in the country as part of a massive crackdown on child pornography. The raids were carried out as part of two cases of circulation of Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM), officials said. They were conducted based on inputs from Interpol Singapore.

373.title: Ankita was killed for refusing 'special services' to resort guests: U'khand Police
373.article_body: Uttarakhand DGP Ashok Kumar on Saturday said 19-year-old Ankita Bhandari, who was allegedly murdered by ex-BJP leader Vinod Arya's son Pulkit, was being pressured to provide 'special services' to guests. She was killed after she refused to provide the 'services', Kumar said. Ankita's friend has reportedly alleged that Pulkit, the resort's owner, was pressuring Ankita to have sex with guests.

374.title: Britannia appoints Rajneet Kohli as CEO, elevates Varun Berry as Executive VC & MD
374.article_body: Britannia Industries' board announced the appointment of Rajneet Kohli as Executive Director and CEO effective September 26, 2022. It also elevated Varun Berry to Executive Vice-Chairman and Managing Director with immediate effect. In his career spanning over 25 years, Kohli has served in senior leadership roles in Asian Paints and Coca-Cola and is joining Britannia from Jubilant FoodWorks.

375.title: Rohit's ability to play against fast bowling is second to none: Karthik
375.article_body: Commenting on India captain Rohit Sharma's 20-ball 46* in second T20I against Australia, India batter Dinesh Karthik said his teammate played brilliantly. "His ability to play against fast bowling is second to none...that's what makes him truly special as a batter," he added. Rohit was adjudged 'Player of the Match'. He hit four fours and four sixes during his knock.

376.title: 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans raised at PFI protest in Pune; probe on
376.article_body: A video of protesters purportedly raising "Pakistan Zindabad" slogans during a protest by the Popular Front of India (PFI) in Pune has surfaced online. Pro-Pakistan slogans were reportedly heard when protesters were taken into custody and made to sit in a police vehicle outside the District Collector's office on Friday. Pune Police said they are investigating the matter.

377.title: I changed a lot after working with Irrfan Khan: Tabu
377.article_body: Actress Tabu said in an interview that she changed a lot after working with Irrfan Khan. The duo shared screen space in films like 'Maqbool' and 'The Namesake'. Tabu added, "It's like those people who come into your life and redefine it and make you see things differently. I learnt to be completely true to my characters and myself."

378.title: Anupam shares video of niece singing song from 'Hichki', says 'She's autistic'
378.article_body: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a video of his niece, Tanvi, singing 'Teri Dastaan' from the film 'Hichki' for him and other family members at a gathering. Along with the video, Anupam wrote that she's autistic. "My [sister's] daughter #Tanvi (Autistic) has...most beautiful smile in the world! She...sings with abundant joy...Enjoy the song and bless her," he wrote.

379.title: 1 worker killed, 3 injured in factory blast in Punjab's Hoshiarpur
379.article_body: A 60-year-old worker, Bhagwati Singh, was killed and three others were injured after a blast at an acetylene manufacturing factory in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Saturday. The explosion reportedly took place at JK Enterprises on Jalandhar road during the refilling of cylinders. Technical experts had been called to determine the cause of the blast, Deputy Superintendent of Police Surinder Pal said.

380.title: 2 killed as typhoon hits central Japan; thousands without power
380.article_body: Typhoon Talas struck central Japan on Saturday, unleashing torrential rains and severe winds that left tens of thousands of households without power, as per local media. Two deaths due to the storm were also reported. Wind speed at the centre of the typhoon was recorded at about 65 km/h with peak gusts of about 90 km/h, Japan's meteorological agency informed.

381.title: He's going to break people's toes: Kaneria after Bumrah's bowling in 2nd T20I
381.article_body: Praising Jasprit Bumrah following his performance in India's six-wicket win against Australia in second T20I, Danish Kaneria said the India pacer is back on track. "Opposition teams must beware, as he's looking in a great rhythm...He bowled an excellent spell under pressure. He's going to break people's toes at...T20 World Cup," he added. Bumrah posted bowling figures of 2-0-23-1.

382.title: PM Modi selectively quoted by western leaders: Russia on 'not an era of war' remark
382.article_body: Russian Ambassador Denis Alipov has reacted to PM Narendra Modi's "not an era of war" remark to Russian President Vladimir Putin, which was lauded at the UN. He said, "Western leaders who quoted the...remarks on Ukraine...conveniently picked out parts of that conversation that suits their rhetoric." He added that Russia also wants a peaceful resolution in Ukraine.

383.title: Doctor dies after car hits bike taxi in Hyderabad; 1 arrested
383.article_body: A doctor died on Saturday after being injured in a road accident in Hyderabad's Malakpet on Tuesday night. Dr Sravani, a resident of Hasthinapuram, was on her way to Malakpet on a bike taxi when a car hit the vehicle. The taxi driver and Sravani sustained injuries. The car driver, who escaped from the site, was taken into custody later.

384.title: Activating Starlink: Musk to Blinken on internet shutdown in Iran
384.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said he is activating satellite internet service, Starlink, amid internet shutdown in Iran over protests. Musk was responding to US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's tweet that the US took action "to advance internet freedom and the free flow of information" to Iranians. US issued guidance to expand internet services to Iranians despite US sanctions.

385.title: Centre's various decisions based on Gandhian philosophy: VP Dhankhar
385.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday asserted that various decisions of central government were based on Gandhian philosophy. The philosophy of 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vishwas, Sabka Vikas and Sabka Prayas' is a Gandhian thought and rises above "all politics", he stated. "The Mahatma's soul will be satisfied" as government ensured two doses of coronavirus vaccine during the pandemic, he added.

386.title: SSB jawans fought and wiped out Naxalism in Bihar & J’khand: Shah
386.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah lauded the role of Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) and said that Naxalism has been finished in Bihar and Jharkhand due to the efforts of jawans. "Naxalism is on the brink of ending in the Bihar and Jharkhand regions...We can even say it is finished here," Shah said.

387.title: Congress 'aged', it will be AAP vs BJP in Gujarat: Raghav Chadha
387.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Saturday said that the Gujarat elections will be a direct contest between his party and the BJP. He dismissed Congress as an "aged" party that hasn't won in almost three decades. "After a 27-year rule of the BJP, now is time for a change, time for the Arvind Kejriwal model of governance," said Chadha.

388.title: MVA govt didn't function as per Bal Thackeray's principles: Maha minister
388.article_body: Maharashtra minister Dadaji Bhuse on Friday criticised former CM Uddhav Thackeray and claimed that the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government did not function as per the principles and teachings of Shiv Sena founder Balasaheb Thackeray. Only the Congress and NCP benefitted from the alliance, Bhuse added. He was addressing a group of Shiv Sena workers from CM Eknath Shinde's faction.

389.title: Dhoni was open to everyone's suggestions: Harbhajan on India's 2007 T20 WC win
389.article_body: Recalling Team India's 2007 T20 World Cup win on its 15th anniversary on Saturday, Harbhajan Singh said it didn't feel to the team that MS Dhoni was the captain before he took the trophy as everyone was giving their suggestions. "He was very open to it and would let us go ahead with whatever we thought was best," he added.

390.title: Cong is playing 'dirty politics': K'taka CM on PayCM campaign
390.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai accused the Congress of playing "dirty politics" in connection with its PayCM campaign in the state. "They should give evidence, records and it has to be investigated. Without anything in their heads, they come to the session. This shows their moral degradation. This campaign is taken without any morality and mudslinging programme," said Bommai.

391.title: Patna HC stays demolition of Sultan Palace, seeks reply from Bihar govt
391.article_body: Patna High Court stayed the proposed demolition of Sultan Palace, commonly known as Parivahan Bhawan, and sought a reply from the Bihar government. This comes after a PIL was filed by a Patna-based lawyer. Bihar government had earlier granted approval for the construction of three five-star hotels in Patna, including one at the site where the Sultan Palace is built.

392.title: MP man stabs 7-yr-old 12 times, says he was helping her meet her parents
392.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Indore reportedly killed his seven-year-old neighbour on Friday. According to the police, the accused abducted the girl, who lost her parents a few years back, took her to his house and stabbed her at least 12 times. "The man said he was trying to help her as she wanted to meet her parents," police said.

393.title: Bankrupt crypto firm Voyager's CFO to quit months after appointment
393.article_body: Cryptocurrency lender Voyager Digital, which filed for bankruptcy in July, announced on Friday that its Chief Financial Officer Ashwin Prithipaul is stepping down from his role and would leave after a "transition period". This comes within months of his appointment in May. Voyager said its Chief Executive Officer Stephen Ehrlich will head the role of the CFO in the interim.

394.title: Ghaziabad man's adopted daughter suspected of killing him
394.article_body: A 14-year-old girl has been identified as the prime suspect in her adoptive father's murder case in Ghaziabad. The man was found dead at his home in Vaishali Sector 4 on Thursday, police said. The deceased and his adopted daughter had a strained relationship over a rape case that was filed against the latter's friend, police said citing his wife.

395.title: Yes Bank to exit Reconstruction Scheme after lock-in period ends
395.article_body: Yes Bank said on Friday it has amended the July 15 announcement regarding its exit from the Reconstruction Scheme, 2020 after receiving clarification from the RBI. The bank said the RBI would allow it to exit the scheme, which it entered in March 2020, after the end of a three-year lock-in period for 75% of shares held by existing shareholders.

396.title: Some investors pull out of Digital World's plan to buy Trump's app
396.article_body: Blank-cheque company, Digital World Acquisition, said some investors are backing out of its plan to acquire former US President Donald Trump's social media firm Truth Social. Investors, who signed the private investment in public equity commitment, have terminated nearly $139 million in investments of $1 billion commitment. Digital World didn't disclose the investors who pulled out investments.

397.title: 28-yr-old man strangles wife to death over argument in Thane, held
397.article_body: A 28-year-old man, Anil Laxman Lokhande, was arrested for allegedly strangling his 25-year-old wife, Meena, to death at their house in Thane's Kalwa over an argument, police said on Saturday. The couple used to frequently fight and the accused strangled his wife in the early hours of Friday, senior inspector Manohar Awhad said.

398.title: Unichem gets ₹270 cr from Sekhmet for 19.97% stake sale in Optimus
398.article_body: Drug firm Unichem Laboratories on Friday said it received ₹270 crore as the first tranche of payment from Sekhmet Pharmaventures Private Limited for the sale of 19.97% equity shares in Optimus Drugs Private Limited. A consortium of private equity funds, led by PAG, had announced in May that it will acquire a controlling stake in Optimus Drugs for ₹2,000 crore.

399.title: Australia's 2nd largest telco Optus contacts customers after data leak
399.article_body: Australia's second-largest telecommunications company said it was contacting "all customers to notify them of the previously announced cyberattack's impact, if any, on their personal details". "We will begin with customers whose ID document number may have been compromised, all of whom will be notified by today...No passwords or financial details have been compromised," Optus said.

400.title: Inspired by crime TV show, 3 people rob Mumbai celebrity dentist of ₹12 lakh
400.article_body: Three people have been arrested for allegedly stealing ₹12 lakh from a celebrity dentist in Mumbai. Reports said that the accused were inspired by a crime television show. The three also stole ornaments and expensive watches, as per reports. Police were able to catch all three accused after scanning over 500 CCTV footages.
